ygData.subject: Re: thinking about EQ -- Part 1
ygData.msgSnippet: No, no flames here for misguided souls (! - I should talk, I ve never even looked at AC). But this should be a fun post to answer. First, I wouldn t be
ygData.messageBody:
No, no flames here for misguided souls (! - I
should talk, I've never even looked at AC).<br><br>But
this should be a fun post to answer. First, I wouldn't
be surprised if they do give you a new key at
customer service; they can figure out if the old one has
been used, and if it hasn't, why not give you a new
one? They want people to play. Or, just get the $9.95
version for now.<br><br>Explain the game? Hm. Hard to
explain an irrational addiction that keeps you up every
night past your bedtime, and leads you to sites like
these during the day where you can daydream about it .
. . <br><br>Here's a question - what kind of player
are you? <br><br>Powergamer -- gotta have lotsa loot,
cool garb, big honkin' weapons and of course, high
levels as quickly as possible so you can kill bigger and
badder stuff?<br><br>Roleplayer -- the journey is the
thing, meeting people, exploring all the nooks and
crannies of a zone?<br><br>Or somewhere in between? Again,
I don't know about AC, but that's the joy of EQ, as
it accomodates all players, even in the same group
sometimes. I'm adventuring on the lizard-continent of
Kunark, now, and I find myself in groups with Iksar (the
playable lizard-man race). My character doesn't quite know
what to think of them, so I tell them as much when
grouping . . . Two nights ago, one told me to "watch your
tongue, little one" and kept making comments on the order
of "You have to skin them; the hair is bad for the
digestion." OK, so I can't tell males and females apart yet .
. . The powergamers in the group just let us have
our fun, meanwhile.<br><br>Here are some tips: Don't
play a Player vs. Player (PvP) server to begin with;
you'll be very frustrated. A "roleplaying" server with a
slightly different ruleset will be launched later this
year, which looks interesting (but no PvP). And don't
turn in your Book of Discord, which allows you to go
PvP on a "blue" (non-PvP) server. You won't be able
to interact with anyone (cast or be cast on, for
example) unless they're also "red."<br><br>Older servers
tend to be more crowded; my server (Drinal) used to be
a green, "preferred" server, but is now just a
regular one. More people=more competition for hunting
grounds, perhaps, but also more people around to help if
you need it, and to sell stuff, theoretically. One or
two servers are "unofficial" roleplay servers, but I
forget which. There's even one with a strong European
contingent.<br> <br>Continued on next post . . . Yahoo! doesn't
like wordy posts!
